The present invention discloses a bedroom cabinet that is formed into a box-shape by a hexahedron consisting of four side surfaces, an upper surface and a lower surface, comprising an outer casing composed of upper and lower outer casings, the upper outer casing having front and rear side portions, left and right side portions and an upper surface portion integrally formed, the front side portion being formed with a notch portion corresponding to the upper half of an exit, the lower outer casing having front and rear side portions, left and right portions and a lower surface portion integrally formed, the front surface portion being formed with a notch portion corresponding to the lower half of the exit; an inner casing positioned within the outer casing and comprising a front surface panel, a back panel, left and right side panels, a ceiling panel and a bottom panel, the front surface panel having an opening in communication with the notches of the upper and lower outer casings and having an area approximately equal to the exit; a peripheral edge at the lower end of the upper outer casing and a peripheral edge at the upper end of the lower upper casing are respectively formed with outwardly projected flanges, and the outer casing is assembled in such a way that the flange of the upper outer casing is brought into abutment with the flange of the lower outer casing. The bedroom cabinet of the present invention is of the dual construction comprising the outer casing and the inner casing, and therefore it is excellent in mechanical strength. In addition, by providing a clearance between the outer casing and the inner casing a box in which electric devices such as an illuminating instrument, an interphone or the like is mounted or a box which serves as a shelf for accommodating therein a user's belongings can be formed in this clearance, and therefore such boxes will not be projected within the cabinet and from the outer periphery of the outer casing. Accordingly, the dwelling area can be effectively utilized, and since the external surfaces of the cabinet are formed to be flat, a plurality of bedroom cabinets can be closed stacked or installed adjacent to each other. The clearance between the outer and inner casings used to form a box can house therein wirings or the like for interior electric devices.

The present invention provides a portable, temporary guard rail support and assembly for use in erecting a safety barrier at construction sites. The guard rail support comprises a substantially flat bottomed base plate, an upright column affixed to the flat bottomed base plate, at least one guard rail support bracket affixed to the upright column, a kick board retaining flange affixed to the flat bottomed base plate in spaced proximal relationship to the upright column, an angular brace affixed to the upright column and the flat bottomed base plate, and a safety tie-off ring affixed to the upright column and the flat bottomed base plate. The guard rail support is useful for providing a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights, particularly in the construction industry. The guard rail support is portable and simple to assemble and disassemble, and can be used in various configurations to meet safety guidelines and rigidity requirements. The guard rail support is also useful for providing a temporary guard railing around the perimeter of a roof structure, along the sides of a bridge construction until permanent guard railings are installed, or along any drop-off edge where it may occur.

The invention includes a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well to extend the effective range of induced vibrations that can be applied to a given reservoir. The discharge section produces EM pulses, while the discharge and induction control sections control the duration and frequency of the pulses. The text describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element, which can be used to lengthen an MSE structure. The splice includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate, each defining transverse protrusions that receive and seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element. The transverse wires are coupled to the grid-strip, and the splice is secured by coupling the wave plates to each other.

The text describes a novel plow blade design that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection. The plow blade is constructed with multiple components that can be easily assembled and modified to meet specific job requirements. The design minimizes the amount of fluid required to eject the utility line, reducing power consumption and wear on the blade. The plow can be tailored to provide fluid injection characteristics to match specific job requirements, and the components are manufactured with traditional manufacturing processes.

The present invention describes a building system that allows panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and greater than 4 meters in width to be created without movement joints. The system uses pre-papered hot-dipped galvanised zinc steel wire MCL StuccoRite Mesh Sheets and other reinforcement to achieve a nominal thickness of 21 mm with a sponge or plastic float finish. The system is installed on timber framing that complies with NZS3604 protected by a building wrap and protected by a building wrap and pre-qualified window sealing tape that complies with Table 23 of E2/AS1 and BQI interim Performance Standard BQI C4021*. The system is waterproofed with a 2 coat paint system in accordance with Paragraph 9.3.7 of E2/AS1. The system is also weatherproofed with a 2 coat paint system in accordance with Paragraph 9.3.7 of E2/AS1. The system is designed to resist wind face loading up to and including those associated with VH wind speed zones. The system is intended to be fixed to timber walls with studs at 600 mm centres, heights up to 4.8 m and dwangs spaced at up to 900 mm centres. The system is able to resist wind face loading up to and including those associated with VH wind speed zones. The text describes a safe construction that includes a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening, a door with inwardly extending ledges, and a lock mechanism. The safe is made of a liner with grooves and bars, and is assembled in a factory to provide a simple, yet effective door and safe structure.

The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths. The pressure transducer is located at a desired depth in the formation, isolated to pressures produced by the formation at such depth. This ensures that the measurement of formation pressure is not affected by other and different pressures that could otherwise exist in the borehole above and below the inlet to the pressure measuring apparatus.

The present invention provides a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, more specifically, a jointing structure which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter and the like, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations and is easy to be given maintenance. The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap. The present invention is adapted to prevent, by blocking up the expansion gap in a bridge girder joint with the joint block while permitting an expansion gap function to be maintained, the occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for the achievement of smooth and safe vehicle traveling (see  FIG. 2 ). It will be appreciated that even in the occurrence of any displacement such as the vertical differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and besides, the kinked joints in the joints of the bridge girders especially due to the earthquake or the like, the joint block may be conditioned to be always in the center of the expansion gap thanks to elastic member deformation for the elimination and/or relief of the differences in level and/or the lateral displacements and the like, resulting in the achievement of smooth vehicle traveling without the need for any emergency measures involving the use of the steel sheets or the like.

The present invention provides an enclosed floor track system for transporting wheeled trucks into and out of a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment. The enclosed track system includes a wheel channel above the floor, which is supported by support legs and overcomes the disadvantage of fixing the route of transfer. The enclosed track system also includes inflatable seals to enclose the interior wheel channel of the track, preventing the brine solution from entering the track system and becoming contaminated. The enclosed track system also prevents the brine solution from leaking into the track system and becoming contaminated.

The lock device according to the present invention is designed to prevent a boom or arm from being tilted by the weight of a work machine, such as a tractor loader backhoe or backhoe. The lock device comprises an engaging member and an engaged member, which can be manually held in a lock position or a lock release position. The engaging member is provided on one side of the boom and the boom bracket, and the engaged member is provided on the other side. The engaging member is formed with a hook part and a slot, and the engaging member can be held in a lock position or a lock release position by sliding the engaging member along the slot. The lock device can be provided on the boom bracket or the work machine frame, and can be used for locking a boom or arm in a state of stored in a main body.

The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus having a flexible platform with a central, suction portion that can be easily adjusted to regulate the suction being exerted by the vacuum head. The invention overcomes the drawbacks of prior art devices by providing a simple adjustment mechanism on the vacuum head itself that enables quick and easy regulation of the suction being exerted by the vacuum head without the need for manual adjustment of the suction source. The adjustment mechanism is conveniently located on the top of the vacuum head and can be quickly operated by hand without the need for hand tools. The invention also includes a roller height adjustment device that can be used in combination with existing suction head assemblies to easily adjust the spacing between the central, suction portion of the platform and the pool bottom.

The present invention provides a retriever apparatus for retrieving wear bushing elements from around the interior of a well head and casing. The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel section and retriever section, which can be mounted onto a drill string independently of threading on the drill bit. The sub-unit is designed to be threadably engaged with the wear bushing, allowing vertical movement of the retriever unit without rotation. The apparatus also includes a protruding member for engaging with the wear bushing, and a groove section for allowing for approximately 3 feet of vertical play. The protruding members are designed to align with the slots in the wear bushing, while the groove sections allow for free rotation. The apparatus is simple, inexpensive, and can be easily removed and installed for quick replacement of worn bushing elements.

The text describes a retaining wall system that uses precast concrete to create a modular structure. The wall consists of a precast face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base. The counterfort extends from the rear side of the face panel and can be used to support the wall. The wall can be installed using pre-manufactured assembly components, which can be transported to the site and assembled at the job site. The wall can be flexible in terms of height and width, and can be used for retaining soil and other materials. The wall can also be used for retaining water.

The present invention provides a down hole heating system for oil and gas wells that addresses the shortcomings of existing heaters and treatments. The system includes an electrical resistance type heater rod and a heat insulating packer and stainless steel collar. The heating unit is designed to focus heat in the production zone and prevent damage to the heating elements and electrical connections. The method of use includes installation of the heating unit and heat-retaining elements, as well as replacement of cable for supporting the heating unit during well treatments.

The present invention is a pulling tool mechanism that includes an overshot structure for engaging and disengaging objects within a well bore. The mechanism is adapted for use in downhole operations such as installation and removal of downhole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost objects. The mechanism includes an upper sub structure with an internal bore and an outer tubular body, an inner body structure with an externally threaded lower portion and an internally threaded upper portion, and a latching and unlatching mechanism for engaging and disengaging the object. The mechanism is designed to be simple and effective for disconnection of the pulling tool from the object if disconnection is necessary.

The example embodiment provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors or engineering floors. The method includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, in the union plane; and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means, normal to the union plane. The invention relates to ladder attachments for positioning the ladder away from the work surface, preventing the ladder from defacing the work surface, and preventing the ladder from slipping or sliding. The invention includes a brace for a ladder having first and second siderails connected by a rung, and a resilient pad assembly pivotally connected to the arm of the brace. The pad assembly is pivotally connected to the arm of the brace to increase the contact area of the ladder with the work surface and resist sliding. The invention also includes a clamp for positioning the arm of the brace in abutting contact with the siderail and arm of the brace.

The text describes a nail strip or collation system for fasteners, including a plastic material molded onto and adhered to the fasteners. The plastic material is molded to form a collar that captures or encircles a nail shank and a connecting portion between adjacent collar portions. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy or the like. The plastic material is molded to form a collar that captures or encircles a nail shank and a connecting portion between adjacent collar portions. The plastic material is also molded to form a connecting portion that extends between adjacent fasteners and is formed with a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location. The plastic material is also molded to form a rib that extends less than the axial length of the collar portion and has a width that is greater than the width of the collar. The rib can be tapered, narrowing toward the tip of the fastener, and the bridge can be tapered, narrowing toward the tip of the fastener. The invention describes a nozzle for applying silicone and similar sealants to multiple machines and artefacts. The nozzle comprises a bell or hood shaped tip and an injection button. It provides several advantageous and novel characteristics, including a bell-shaped section with multiple channels and orifices for precise sealing, a button section with lateral outlets for optimal sealing, and a bell or hood lower section for both manual and automated applications. The invention also simplifies sealing work by providing a device that reduces the sealant application time, saves time and labour, and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application.

The text describes a position sensor that uses a waveform generator to modify an unconditioned sensing signal to provide a conditioned sensing signal. The sensor monitors the movement of an object within a specified window of time and adjusts the output signal based on the object's position. The sensor also includes a window reference circuit that compares the sensor output to a reference signal and adjusts the output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal. The sensor also includes a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit that constantly compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal that is subtracted from the offset and error signal to deliver a sensor output that is as close to the desired minimum value as is practical without requiring unnecessary circuitry.

The text describes a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, including a valve system with a linearly reciprocating actuation system by a rotating cam and translating means interacting with a second controllable actuating means that controls valve position. The system is described as having variable valve displacement, which can be controlled by computer control, and is designed to be simple, robust, and precise, with minimal mass inertia and positive essentially springless control during actuation. The system can be used with multiple valves per cylinder and includes multiple valve assemblies for individual intake and exhaust valves.

The text describes a light member for aquarium lighting, which includes a housing with a top and bottom side, a lighting control region, and switches for controlling the light. The light member can be used in various configurations, including under cabinets, in series, or in series with other light members. The switches allow for remote control and on/off settings.

The present invention describes a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly for a gas turbine, which avoids the disadvantages of existing apparatuses and is simple to produce, can be flexibly matched to the respective application, and is efficiently cooled. The apparatus includes separating walls and deflection devices that are inserted into the apparatus and secured there. The separating walls are composed of metal or non-metal materials, and the deflection devices are bent into a U-shape. The apparatus can be adapted to various blade geometries, including rotating guide apparatuses such as rotor blades. The apparatus is characterized by its simple design, ease of assembly, and ability to adjust the cooling system.

The summary of the text is: The present invention provides a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, including a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor that automatically sets the throttle position for optimum performance, and a control unit that provides an output signal to control a clutch. The system can be switched between manual and automatic control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall.

The invention relates to a waste fuel burner that burns wood waste to produce clean, low-temperature heat. The burner includes a primary combustion chamber with a conical pile of waste fuel fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile in controlled amounts. The volatile gases driven off the pile by heat generated by the oxidation of the fixed carbon on the surface of the pile are partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially with a very vigorous swirl in a first or primary combustion chamber with the total amount of combustion air admitted to the primary chamber being maintained at less than stoichiometric proportions so that the temperature in the primary chamber remains lower than the necessary to melt the natural ash, dirt or other inorganic substances in the fuel. The additional or swirl air is introduced in an amount necessary to maintain a steady temperature at the exit of the primary chamber and is dependent upon the moisture content and type of fuel. The swirl air also forces particulate out of the gas stream leaving the primary chamber. The volatile gases are discharged from the throat of the primary combustion chamber around an air cooled disc or flame holder which forces the gases, and any entrained particulate matter, out to the walls of the throat, thereby causing such entrained matter, if any, to centrifugally separate and fall back into the primary chamber. The secondary chamber is also provided with a side wall, roof, outlet, and refractory lining. The volatile gases pass through discharge 12 from the primary chamber, work their way past an air cooled horizontal, disc-shaped flame holder, and enter the secondary chamber. The secondary chamber is surrounded by an inner vortex of upward spiralling flame and a secondary vortex of downward spiralling combustion air. The flame holder serves as a barrier and prevents secondary chamber particulate material from entering the secondary chamber. The quantity of high pressure swirl air admitted to the primary chamber is varied according to the primary chamber exit temperature measured by thermocouple 70. The primary chamber volatiles readily find their way up through the center of the pressure isolator and into the secondary chamber. The quantity of high pressure swirl air admitted to the primary chamber is varied according to the primary chamber exit temperature measured by thermocouple 70. The primary chamber volatiles readily find their way up through the center of the pressure isolator and into the secondary chamber.

The text describes a fluid pump system for pumping liquids from a reservoir to a desired location. The pump system includes two pump heads arranged in series, each having a first and second impeller. The first impeller is mounted on a first drive shaft, and the second impeller is mounted on a second drive shaft. The first and second drive shafts are connected by a biconical tubular connector, which bridges the first and second pump heads and provides extra strength to withstand torsional forces. The connector is integrally formed with the first impeller and the second impeller, and the connector is frictionally secured within the connector. The pump system also includes a third pump head, which is the same as the second pump head, but has a third inlet designed like the first inlet of the first pump head. The pump system is mounted on a wheeled boom or hitching assembly, and can be easily separated for maintenance or additional pump heads. The pump system can be used to pump fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure, and can be tailored for different applications by adjusting the number of pump heads in the series.

The text describes an engine compression release brake system for less than all engine cylinders. The system includes a modular engine housing with multiple engine cylinders, each with an engine compression release brake operably connected to an exhaust valve for the cylinder. The system can be used with any number of cylinders and can provide sufficient engine braking horsepower for a specific application. The system can be modifiable to include modular characteristics and can be used with any number of cylinders and can provide sufficient engine braking horsepower for a specific application.

The text describes a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox, which includes a male link and a female link. The male link receives the female link to allow translation relative to the female link and forms a radial interface that dampens translation. The pin is releasably coupled to the male link and the female link to selectively retain the male link and the female link. The link assembly can withstand extreme loads from blade-off events and other sudden or extreme shocks.

The invention provides a small, lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted in weight to achieve perfect balance. The point cap system is made from hardened steel and is attached to an arrow shaft using an epoxy adhesive. The balance pin is adjustable to balance an arrow shaft, and the point cap and balance pin work together to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft when the arrow points are not attached.

The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is a cost-effective, low-cost, and reliable small arms training device that simulates small arms fire noise and flash. It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing, a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system, and an expendable that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech. The device produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner which utilizes the weapon's ejection port. The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt. The SAFES is an affordable, cost-effective, and reliable small arms training device that can be used with an M16 rifle.

The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves the volumetric efficiency of the engine by utilizing the dynamic effects of the air flow. The device comprises a tank defining a volume, a first pipe defining a first passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a second pipe defining a second passage interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage. The first and second passages are open to the intake passage at different locations with respect to each other, and the cross-sectional area of the second passage is smaller than that of the first passage. A valve is disposed in the first passage together with a valve actuating means responsive to an engine operating condition. The valve is preferably positioned at the tank-side opening of the passage defined by pipe 5, and the valve is actuated by an actuator 8 comprising a vacuum diaphragm actuator. The valve is fixed to the diaphragm 8a by a valve rod 8c, and the apparatus has a vacuum chamber 8d defined by the diaphragm 8a and the casing 8b. A compressed spring 8e urges the diaphragm 8a in the direction toward which the valve 7 is closed. The valve 7 is turned to open or close when the engine load is changed, and the valve 7 is operated in a manner as shown in FIG. 2.

The invention provides a bracket assembly for mounting a speaker or other object to a variety of surfaces, including poles, pipes, columns, walls, and the like. The bracket assembly includes a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket. The adjustable bracket is attached to the object to be mounted and can be positioned on the surface or pole. The adjustable bracket is connected to the stationary bracket via tabs and hooks, which allow for easy adjustment of the angle of the bracket. The bracket assembly is designed to be simple to install and requires only two people to complete the installation. The adjustable bracket can be used on walls without the pole adapter, and it is resistant to weather, wind, and vibration. The bracket assembly is suitable for loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, video cameras, and other equipment.

The disclosed concepts address the need for an efficient, clean burning burner capable of being used with diverse heat utilizing appliances. The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and tertiary combustion air flowing through the exhaust outlet. The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber well above ground level, and a pivotally coupled ash pan. The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner, and the modular heat utilizing appliances include closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The disclosed concepts provide an efficient, clean burning burner and a system for removably attaching heat utilizing appliances thereto, with the burner having a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall, with air flowing through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and tertiary combustion air flowing through the exhaust outlet.

The invention relates to a rotary internal combustion engine housing structure that incorporates circumferential cooling flow paths for spark plug bosses. The invention includes staggered boss arrangements with offset staggered boss configurations to minimize thermal distortion and improve cooling characteristics. The housing structure also includes flow diverters or flow controllers to ensure a controlled flow regime between the bosses and for strengthening the housing structure. The results of tests on a water model passageway simulating the passage of spark plug bosses indicate that the staggered configuration of the bosses increases the heat transfer coefficient and reduces thermal distortion, resulting in improved cooling and combustion efficiency.

The text describes a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. The method uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance, minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during testing. The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow change due to closure of one of the N parallel flow paths during valve testing results in a change to the system that is controlling pressure from N valves to N-1 valves. The flow characteristic for each valve of the system with N valves, and for the system with N-1 valves, is determined during the turbine design process. The flow characteristics are based on total flow and individual valve stem lift. For any given valve not under test, the difference in the flow-lift characteristic between the N and the N-1 condition is known. The flow difference between the N and the N-1 condition is applied to the total flow demand to each of the N-1 valves on the basis of the total N valve demand derived from the position of the valve under test.

The text describes a mixing valve system for cleaning aircraft, which allows for continuous control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water emerging from outlet passage 38, with adjustable flow rates and reduced flow rates for each fluid source.

The text describes a method for compressing natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline. The method includes compressing the gas at individual intervals to a higher pressure, cooling the compressed gas by heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and expanding the gas from the excess pressure to the desired exit pressure. The method is particularly useful in permanent frost areas where the ground thaws during the summer months to a depth of about 80 to 100 cm and remains otherwise permanently frozen. The method reduces the investment and operation risk compared to conventional re-cooling technology. The invention is not limited by the described embodiments but can be modified within the scope of protection.

The text describes a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure. The system includes a cooling fan assembly that is mounted to a panel and includes a motor that rotates a fan blade by way of a motor output shaft. The motor is electrically powered and includes non-rotatable housing that houses the operative components. The housing is coupled to a motor carrier that includes a plurality of mounting legs that terminate into turned-out portions that are sized to fit into enlarged openings in the enclosure. The compressed spring member urges the motor carrier away from the panel when the turned-out portions are inserted into the openings. The mount uses six identical strut elements to provide passive energy dissipating mechanisms, which can be used to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The mount also allows for the design of six suspension modes, which can be used to reduce the loads transmitted to the instrument. The mount can be modified by inserting vibration damping materials into the mounts, which can dissipate into heat and reduce the high energy disturbances to the instrument. The mount can also be used to design damping or loss factors for the VEM materials used in the mounts. The text describes a novel clutch unit for an oil shear type catapult system, which includes interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston means for each disc segment, fluid pressure control, and auxiliary fluid cooling. The unit minimizes residual drag and disc friction, and provides improved torque control and cooling.

The text describes a system for reducing exhaust emissions in internal combustion engines, including a cascade of expansion cylinders that capture and recycle exhaust gases. The system uses water injection to cool the exhaust gases and recapture heat energy, reducing the need for a radiator and eliminating the need for a radiator. The system also captures and recovers heat from the exhaust gases, reducing the overall exhaust temperature and minimizing the amount of heat lost to the environment. The text also describes a water recovery system that recovers water from the crankcase and uses it to cool the expansion cylinders and improve mechanical efficiency.

The present invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy. On at least one precoated face of the plate, an area situated at the periphery of the plate has the metal alloy layer removed. The precoat is preferably an alloy of aluminum or based on aluminum. The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm. The width of the area from which the metal layer has been removed is preferably between 0.4 and 30 mm. The thickness of the intermetallic alloy layer is preferably between 3 and 10 micrometers. The area from which the metal alloy has been removed is preferably produced by partly eliminating the metal alloy layer on at least one precoated face of the plate by brushing. The area from which the metal alloy has been removed can be produced by partly eliminating the alloy layer on at least one precoated face of the plate by means of a laser beam. The invention also provides a welded blank obtained by butt-welding at least two plates according to a preferred embodiment of the present invention, the welded joint being produced on the edge contiguous with the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed. The invention further provides a part obtained by heat treatment and deformation of a welded blank according to a preferred embodiment of the present invention, the precoat being converted throughout its thickness by the heat treatment into an intermetallic alloy compound providing protection against corrosion and decarburization of the steel substrate. The invention even further provides a plate, blank or part according to a preferred embodiment, the composition of the steel comprising, by weight: 0.10%C0.5%, 0.5%Mn3%, 0.1%Si1%, 0.01%Cr1%, Ti0.2%, Al0.1%, S0.05%, P0.1%, 0.0005%B0.010%, the remainder consisting of iron and inevitable impurities resulting from the production process. The composition of the steel preferably comprises, by weight: 0.15%C0.25%, 0.8%Mn1.8%, 0.1%Si0.35

The present invention pertains to a remote control system and algorithm for supervisory control and data acquisition enabling navigation and automatic operation of a mobile energy recovery system. The system includes a mobile structure that extracts energy from severe weather patterns, including windstorms, tropical storms, and hurricanes. The system utilizes weather satellite data to track the mobile structure's position and velocity, and weather satellite data or alternate sources of weather information to communicate with the central service facility. The system employs a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) to control the mobile structure's mechanical members and sensors, and a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to display visual representations of the mobile structure's position, heading, velocity, and points of sail. The system also includes a human-machine interface (HMI) secure software application that allows for remote human interaction and navigation planning. The system is designed to automatically navigate the mobile structure in response to environmental conditions, and is capable of operating in remote control environments, such as offshore energy recovery systems.

The invention describes a rolling body guide cage with a ring element produced from a sheet metal material and having an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and are welded to one another in a forming step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling. The ring segments are cut out from a sheet metal material and punched out in close succession to form a joined together ring element for a rolling body guide cage. The rolling body guide cage is suitable for radial and axial bearing cages, particularly for groove and angular ball bearings, and can be structured such that it is composed of a first ring element and a structurally identical second ring element positioned in mirror-symmetry. The rolling body guide cage can be manufactured by forming techniques in a forming step, where the ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction. The rolling body guide cage can also be manufactured by joining together the initially punched out or otherwise cut out ring segments with alignment of the edges to form a stack or ring segment block and then supplying this to a welding station for welding. The rolling body guide cage can also be manufactured by joining together the initially punched out or otherwise cut out ring segments with alignment of the edges to form a stack or ring segment block and then supplying this to a welding station for welding.

The provided text discusses methods and systems for obtaining and transmitting information related to providing customer service at a customer service location. These systems include a service technician visiting a customer service location, accessing a technician server to receive and transmit information, and using a GPS system to acquire and transmit latitude and longitude coordinates. The system also includes a mapping system for routing travel between customer service locations and generating directions for service technicians. The text also mentions that the GPS system can be used to provide knowledge of service technician locations and customer service locations, which can facilitate moving the next best or available service technician to the next highest priority or most appropriate service location.

The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, including two real triaxial magnetic field sensors and three pairs of compensation coils. The system includes a control unit with six inputs and six outputs for generating six virtual sensor signals and six control signals for six coils. The virtual sensor signals are fed to independent control loops operating in parallel, and the control signals are converted into real control signals for controlling the coils. The feedback part of the virtual sensor signals is expanded to obtain the virtual sensor signals, and the feedback matrix C is used to eliminate crosstalk between the two compensation systems. The invention also provides a standard installation of the systems, where only one system is installed, and no feedback effects occur.

The text describes a system for assessing and comparing segmentation files used in radiation therapy, including comparing segmentations from different sources and evaluating the quality of segmentation. It also provides a method for customizing metric methods based on specific structures and their characteristics.

The text describes a floating point execution apparatus that includes an effective subtraction operation. The apparatus includes a subset difference apparatus that determines the difference between a subset of operand exponent argument signals. The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof). The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions, a quantity that is available. The apparatus also includes a detection and logic unit that determines the operand fraction and a shift and selection logic unit that selects the appropriate procedure based on the difference between the operand exponent arguments. The apparatus also includes a subtraction unit that calculates the final fraction result based on the operand fraction and operand exponent arguments.

It outlines a method for collecting blood specimens from patients, including storing patient information, order information, and barcode numbers in a relational database. The text describes a voice activated distance measuring device for golfers. The device uses voice recognition technology and GPS technology to provide golf course parameters and distance information. It can be worn on a hat or headgear and can be used for various applications such as hiking, surveyors, and hunters. The device can also be used for scuba divers using underwater design. The device can be expanded to include its use in any portable application. It can also be used for golfers to upload golf course GPS coordinate data while in the pro shop or retail outlet without needing a wired connection or even removing the hat device from his/her head.

The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic. The system and method eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the tool. The customized design rules are based on modifying a standard set of Logic Rules as needed to reflect needs of particular regions in the chip. The system and method also creates customized design rule check command files based on modifying a standard logic rule file to take into consideration minimum dimensional values extracted from memory bit cell design parameters. The system and method also provides a program that can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems for creating customized rules and performing design rule checks on mask pattern data based on such customized rule sets.

The invention described in the source document is a waveguide hologram illuminator that can be used to illuminate objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators. The invention utilizes thin substrate waveguides to provide high diffraction efficiencies and uniform illumination, while also compensating for non-uniformity in the diffracted wavefront.

The text describes a dynamoelectric machine rotor test apparatus and method, which includes a test fixture with a test head and a retraction and drive mechanism. The test head includes a core with a magnetic material stack and conductive bars, and excites the rotor using an alternating current. The apparatus acquires data from the rotor using voltage sensing and skew sensing sensors, and calculates resistance, reactance, skew, and dissymmetry values. The data is stored on a Winchester magnetic disk and printed on a printer. The apparatus is used to test squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, including resistance, reactance, and skew measurements. The test apparatus is particularly useful for identifying rotor defects and evaluating manufacturing processes and quality control.

The provided text describes various aspects of a system and method for managing and securing mobile devices. It outlines the process of validating digital certificates associated with managed libraries, authorizing requests to access native system resources, and verifying managed dependencies in a mobile device. The text also discusses the verification of managed libraries, the transmission of digital signatures, and the verification of managed dependencies. It mentions the use of a validation system, a community feedback server, and an electronic market place to manage and secure mobile devices. The text also describes the verification of managed libraries, the transmission of digital signatures, and the verification of managed dependencies.

The invention provides an identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed. The card is then laminated between rigid outer layers to protect the electronic components. The invention differs from prior art cards in that it uses a low-cost, shock-absorbing structure with rigid outer layers that distribute external forces over a broad area of compliant layers to protect the electronic components.

The text describes a novel implementation of a queue in a memory, specifically a FIFO queue. The solution involves using a tree-shaped data structure to store the nodes, with each node having a given maximum size and the ability to add and delete records. The tree structure is balanced and mirrors the FIFO queue, allowing for faster updates and less memory usage. The header node, which indicates the end and beginning of the queue, is added to the data structure. The queue can be inverted in constant time and space, and the header node can be used to invert the queue in the basic embodiment. The text also mentions that the queue can be used as a double-ended queue, allowing for both additions and deletions.

The summary of the text is as follows:

The present invention provides methods and devices for building embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies. The primary objective is to provide EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits using existing DRAM technology. Another objective is to provide EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies. The invention also aims to eliminate the need for high voltages for its operations, making it practical for applications requiring high voltages.

The text describes two embodiments of an invention for determining feedback gains in feedback control systems. The first embodiment involves continuously driving the AGV along a running course while continuously adjusting the AGV's speed and steering angle to determine the optimal values of the P, I, and D gains. The second embodiment involves continuously driving the AGV along a running course while continuously adjusting the AGV's speed and steering angle to determine the optimal values of the P, I, and D gains. The first embodiment uses a fixed range for the P, I, and D gains, while the second embodiment uses a function interpolation method to determine the optimal values. The text also mentions that the invention is applicable to cases of obtaining the optimum values of feedback gains other than the P, I, and D gains, and that the evaluation functions for the gains are not limited to the ones used in the first embodiment.

The invention provides a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and a standard image angle at the wide angle end with a reduced total length and good optical performance throughout the entire zooming range. The invention comprises a first lens unit with a positive refractive power for focusing, a second lens unit with a negative refractive power for varying the image magnification, a third lens unit with a negative refractive power for compensating for the shift of an image plane, a fourth lens unit with a positive refractive power for making the diverging light beam from the third lens unit an almost parallel light beam, and a fifth lens unit with a positive refractive power for image forming and comprising six lens elements of positive, negative, positive, negative, positive, and positive powers in this order. The lens design parameters are adjusted to achieve high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range. The invention achieves a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation with zooming of aberrations, and it is further improved by constructing the fourth and fifth lens units with specific forms.

The text describes a method and device for detecting elementary particles, including a detector that generates a charge pulse when a particle passes through it. The method involves discharging the charge pulse on the low-voltage side, amplifying individual signals in a fast amplifier and integrating signals in a slow amplifier. The device also includes a support capacitor to separate signals at overlapping rates. The method and device aim to detect individual particles and integrate their signals, enabling reliable detection and measurement of small-size signals over a wide range of signal rates.

The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies. The apparatus includes a test enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and means for moving the movable ring toward the stationary ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly. The apparatus generates an electrical signal representative of the distance between the rings and the starting position of the torque motor output shaft, and compares this signal to a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances. The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of whether the assembly is good or bad, minimizing the chances of operator error.

The text describes the principles and methods of face age-estimation, including contourlet appearance modeling, feature extraction, and age classifier training. It outlines the steps for generating a face age-estimation, including extracting landmark points, applying a contourlet appearance model, and training an age classifier. The text also discusses the implementation of the methods in a computing system, including the use of a database of second image data, feature extraction algorithms, and SVM-based classifiers. The text concludes by describing the various embodiments of the methods, including alpha-numeric input devices, removable disk drives, and video displays.

The text describes a matrix display device that combines two images, one from a night vision sensor and one from an infrared sensor, to create a combined image. The device uses a microdisplay with active matrix OLEDs with white emitters (or emitters in the first color C1) and red colored filters (or filters in the second color C2) to form the matrix of pixels. The combined image can be displayed on a dedicated display panel with four pixels arranged in squares. The device can adjust the intensity of the first image to compensate for saturation in the second image, and can use complementary colors for the pixels P2 and P3 to display the first image in areas where no overlays are present or where the intensity of the overlays is below a threshold. The device can also use the pixels P2 and P3 to display the second image in areas where the intensity of the overlays is below a threshold.

The text describes a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, including a payment element that can be removed from the housing of the identification transmitter. The payment element can be removably attached independently in the receptacle of the housing, and can have a chip, including a microprocessor, circuit, storage device, etc., in order to carry out payment actions with the payment system. The closure can be designed as a dummy plug which is designed with corresponding contact elements which can be plugged into the contact elements of the housing, and can be moved between its active position and its passive position to effectively seal-off the contact elements and protect the electronics. The closure can serve as an advertisement or information board on which information, particularly a logo, letters, a combination of numbers, advertisement information, etc. can be applied.

The text describes various methods for adjusting the tribo charge of toner in an imaging device, including intelligent methods for determining inactivity periods and predicting user next cycles. These methods use sensor data to measure and predict the decay of the toner charge, and then adjust the toner supply based on the calculated decay. The disclosed methods can be implemented in software or hardware, and can be easily combined to achieve more accurate toner charge adjustments.

The present invention provides a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that permits independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure.

The invention provides a system and method for locating and tracing concealed, elongated, conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object. The system includes a transmitter and a receiver, with the transmitter inducing alternating currents in the objects and the receiver sensing magnetic fields associated with the currents. The system can improve the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing the objects by producing two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, allowing for easier and more accurate tracing of one or both cables. The system can also be used in environments where the horizontal separation between cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced.

The text describes a portable hands-free telephonic interfacing system for an incoming telephone call. The system includes an optocoupler for coupling the telephone ringing circuit to the speaker phone, an optocoupler for coupling the telephone ringing circuit to the timer, and a timer for controlling the length of time of the interconnection. The system also includes a switch for bypassing the timer and a hang-up switch for resetting the timer. The system is modular and can be easily moved to various telephone jack locations.

The text describes a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch fiber optic ring network. The system utilizes branch fiber optic cables to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength, without the need for repeaters. The system reduces the number of undersea repeaters required, allowing for more efficient and reliable undersea lightwave communications networks.

The invention provides a cover plate device that can be installed over a wall-mounted electrical wiring device and is fastened to the wiring device using screws. The device includes a cover plate member with two mounting screws that can be separated to allow viewing of the assembly. The mounting screws have a small square of insulation to insulate the wiring device from the mounting ears of the ganged box. The device also includes a rocker switch and a cover plate member with a main aperture that can be used to pry off the cover plate when assembled to the attachment plate. The device can be installed to cover a double ganged box with four mounting ears and four wiring devices.

The present invention provides a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner. The strips are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and can slide over one another between a pushed-in position, in which they essentially cover one another, and a pushed-out position, in which they are essentially uncovered. The strips can be of solid design, for example produced by injection-moulding, but may also be produced by bending plate material, preferably provided with integrated hook or locking elements. The invention provides an adapter member providing a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device. The strips can be of solid design, for example produced by injection-moulding, but may also be produced by bending plate material, preferably provided with integrated hook or locking elements.

The text describes an invention that automatically informs a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when that rate is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can understand. The invention uses acoustic and semantic clarity to determine a speaking rate threshold and compares it to a listening rate to warn the speaker to slow down when the speaking rate exceeds the threshold. The invention can be implemented in various devices and can be used to facilitate understanding between discourse participants, including in telephony, voice networks, and other communication scenarios.

The invention provides a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, in order to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane on which the processes are projected. The device also includes a cyclic line counter, which carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses respectively, N/p being an integer >1, the end-of-count pulse being applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression. The device also includes a sawtooth generator synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and to control the vertical deviation of the beam. The sawtooth generator and the beam suppression circuit are controlled via a delay device, the delay time of which constitutes a selectable part of a line period and which is triggered by the output of the counter. The device is further explained with respect to the pulse diagrams of FIG. 2.

The present invention provides a solution in the packet domain for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call. The blended call is a call that blends voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session. The multimedia server manages the blended call, using the functions of the multimedia server where appropriate and the telephony server where appropriate. The blender software initiates parallel voice and multimedia components with the customer premises equipment. The voice session passes through the telephony server with an indication that blended processing has occurred. The blender further keeps control of the signaling paths of the parallel components so that the bearer path may be controlled to accommodate multimedia requests at any stage during the call.

The text describes a content synchronization framework that allows connected devices to synchronize content based on dynamic attributes and file bundles. It outlines the process of creating bundles, prioritizing downloads, and downloading files in response to client requests. The framework is scalable, flexible, and can handle limited bandwidth and connection times.

The text describes the principles and implementation details of a system and method for facilitating communication between a finder of an object and an owner of the object, allowing anonymous communication and tracking of contact information. The system and method use RFID tags to provide unique identifiers and virtual locales for tracking and communication.

The text describes the invention, which includes a foil electron multiplier that uses a series of thin foils to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages. The foil electron multiplier has a voltage gradient between stages that accelerates secondary electrons through the foil, generating secondary electrons that continue on to the next foil in the series. The foil electron multiplier has a gain per multiplication stage that increases with the foil thickness, and can be used for amplification of an incident electron flux or for detection of particles. The foil electron multiplier has a gain advantage over conventional electron multipliers due to the higher electron transmission through the foil.

The text describes a preferred embodiment of a 3-D Phenomenoscope that allows viewers to view motion pictures with a 3-dimensional effect. The 3-D Phenomenoscope uses a lens control algorithm to synchronize the viewer's left and right lenses to the lateral motion of the motion picture. The algorithm identifies synchronization events based on the presence or absence of lateral motion, and controls the state of the lenses accordingly. The algorithm can detect and correct for head movement, and can use various synchronization events to control the lenses of the viewer glasses. The preferred embodiment uses a simple algorithm to identify synchronization events, and can use more complex algorithms to detect and control the lenses of the viewer glasses.

The present invention discloses a method and apparatus for the dicing of semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw. The method includes forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer and applying a mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die. The apparatus comprises a pad for supporting the wafer and a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad. A pressure mechanism is provided to apply the mechanical pressure to the wafer. The method is useful for dicing semiconductor wafers with thousands of die and dozens or hundreds of scribe lines, and it can be used to singulate individual die on the wafer without the use of a wafer saw.

The summary is as follows:

The present invention provides a novel protection structure for preventing burnout damage to field emission elements in a field emission display device. The structure includes one or multiple reduction plates or electrodes on the cathode, typically on the cathode, which are interspersed among field emission elements in the device. The reduction plates or electrodes deflect the discharge path of gas ions away from the cathode, preventing surges in electrical current from being drawn to the cathode and inducing burnout damage to field emission elements. The protection structure includes a bias voltage source to apply a negative voltage to the reduction plates or electrodes, which reduces the charge on the reduction plates and attracts positive nitrogen and oxygen ions to the cathode, preventing current-induced damage to the field emission elements. The protection structure is arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among field emission elements in the device.

The invention describes an image sensor comprising multiple imaging planes arranged on a top surface of a semiconductor substrate. The sensor includes charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region in which charge carriers are generated by light impinging on the surface of one edge. The sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, such as in the simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or in the surface imaging of passageways. The sensor can also be used for color applications in which a red filter is placed over the image sensor elements in one imaging plane, a green filter covers the elements in a second imaging plane, and a blue filter covers the elements in a third imaging plane. The invention has been described in detail with particular reference to the preferred embodiments thereof, but it will be understood that variations and modifications can be effected within the spirit and scope of the invention.

The text describes several embodiments of a home network system that includes a network master node that automatically promotes itself to become a new network master node when a network slave node fails or goes off-line. The network master node transfers network administrative functions from the network slave node to itself, minimizing total power consumption while ensuring that only the best qualified of available network slave nodes is promoted to the network master role.

The invention provides an antenna array for measuring the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation. The array comprises at least four antennae spaced so as to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, each triplet characterized by the spacing of its elements and the height of the centre element above the ground plane. The array can be used in either receive or transmit mode, and one application is to measure the elevation angle of an aircraft carrying a transponder. The array can be optimized for unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees and measurement accuracy and resolution of the order +/-0.05 degrees from 3 degrees, at which aircraft normally approach to land, down to the lowest angle possible (about +0.5 degrees in this case). The array can be used to determine the range, identity and elevation angle of an aircraft carrying a suitable transponder.

The present invention provides a subminiature lamp assembly with a high temperature polymer surrounding the glass envelope. The polymer is compressed into a seal support that provides axial sealing, heat resistance, and ease of handling. The seal support is made of a fluoroelastomer that offers extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack. The seal support is designed to provide a liquid tight seal and prevent liquid from entering the subminiature lamp interior. The seal support is also designed to protect the electrical leads and prevent burns from accidental contact with the metal housing. The seal support is made of a polymeric material that is non-thermally conducting and able to withstand significant subminiature lamp temperature. The seal support is designed to provide a liquid tight seal and prevent liquid from entering the subminiature lamp interior. The seal support is also designed to protect the electrical leads and prevent burns from accidental contact with the metal housing. The text describes a method for configuring a generalized decision feedback equalizer (GDFE) based precoder in a base station of a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system. The method significantly reduces computational costs while maintaining system capacity. It is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including future "4G" cellular networks. The described implementation relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (S zz ) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise." This is the key component in conventional GDFE precoder design and requires extensive computational cost. The proposed method does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (S xx ) for downlink channel is rank deficient.

The invention provides a heat-dissipating fan and a housing thereof, wherein an axial fan is disposed in the housing to dissipate heat to the outside. The housing includes an outer frame having an air inlet and an air outlet, and an inclined portion or beveled edge is formed at the sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side. The inclined portion or beveled edge can increase the intake airflow area and reduce noises of the turbulent flow produced owing to uneven intake airflow area of the conventional fan. The housing may be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions with the system and the heat dissipation elements. The air passage formed by the sidewall of the passage reduces gradually and evenly in its cross-sectional area, and the air streams produced by the rotation of blades of the impeller can be effectively concentrated to the center and then blow to the center portion of the heat sink having the highest temperature when the heat sink is assembled with the heat-dissipating device so as to enhance its heat-dissipating efficiency.

The text describes an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors according to situations. It explains the structure of the panel, including various layers and materials used, and how the panel can be modified to display different colors. The panel can be used in various applications, such as instrument panels for automobiles, and can be made in a simple structure and at a low cost. The panel can also be modified to display different colors by changing the driving voltage.

The invention provides an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, including an audio means for reproducing sound, a converting means for converting sound into transmission data, a protocol means for handling and controlling communication, and a wireless communications means for wireless near field communication. The terminal also includes a calculating/processing unit for controlling and coordinating various parts, and a service server for handling and controlling the connection/coupling equipment. The terminal also includes a speech recognition means for analyzing and interpreting sound for recording and transmission, and a chat-line, chat-rooms, telephone meetings, etc. functionalities. The terminal also includes a battery and a microprocessor for managing the terminal's power consumption. The invention also provides a computer-readable medium comprising a program written thereon, which when executed, causes the computer to perform the method according to the present invention.

The text discusses the use of high-dielectric oxide materials, particularly Pb/Bi-containing oxides, in semiconductor circuitry. It explains that Pb/Bi oxide materials are convenient due to their low annealing temperatures and desirable properties in small grains. The integration of non-SiO2-based oxides directly or indirectly on Si is difficult because of Si's reactivity with oxygen. The deposition of non-SiO2-based oxides has generally resulted in the formation of a SiO2 or silicate layer at the Si//oxide interface. This layer is amorphous and has a low dielectric constant. These properties degrade the usefulness of non-SiO2-based oxides with Si. High-dielectric constant oxide (e.g., a ferroelectric oxide) can have a large dielectric constant, a large spontaneous polarization, and a large electrooptic properties. Ferroelectrics with a large dielectric constant can be used to form high density capacitors but can not be deposited directly on Si because of the reaction of Si to form a low dielectric constant layer. Such capacitor dielectrics have been deposited on inert metals such as Pt, but even Pt or Pd must be separated from the Si with one or more conductive buffer layers. The large spontaneous polarization of ferroelectrics when integrated directly on a semiconductor can also be used to form a non-volatile, non-destructive readout, field effect memory. Ferroelectrics also have interesting electrooptic applications where epitaxial films are preferred in order to reduce loss due to scattering from grain boundaries and to align the oxide in order to maximize its anisotropic properties. The integration of oxides on GaAs is even harder than Si because the GaAs is unstable in O2 at the normal growth temperatures of high-dielectric constant oxide (450C.-700C). An epitaxial Ge layer on Si provides a good buffer layer which is compatible with Si and also many oxides. Unlike other buffer layers, Ge is a semiconductor (it can also be doped to provide a reasonably highly conductive layer) and is compatible with Si process technology. The epitaxial growth of Ge on top of the ferroelectric or high-dielectric constant oxide is also much easier than Si which makes it possible to form three dimensional epitaxial structures. The Ge buffer layer can be epitaxially gown on the Si substrate allowing the high dielectric constant oxide to be epitaxially gown on the Ge and hence epitaxially aligned

The invention provides a receiver input circuit that eliminates unwanted signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, while maintaining small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit includes a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage, and a second amplification control loop whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage. The third amplification control loop has a lower effective band width than the first and second control circuits and is controlled by a PIN diode. The input network includes three reactance elements and a PIN diode for controllable signal attenuation, the preamplifier stage with a bipolar transistor in grounded-base circuits, the mixer and oscillator stage with the resonant circuit, the rectifier circuits, and the control signal processing circuit. The circuit also includes a capacitor for smoothing the signal-dependent direct signals and a shunt resistor for controlling the PIN diode. The control circuit is based on a PIN diode and has the advantage of protecting the input circuit from negative influences caused by strong spurious signals.

The text describes a collaborative work-sharing environment that can be implemented using PC-based technology. It outlines a method and apparatus for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between two or more parties to a telephone call, without complex and time-consuming setup processes as are common in the prior art. The preferred embodiment includes a collaboration indicator and button that can be activated by one party to initiate a collaborative session. The system can be implemented over a network, such as a corporate LAN, WAN, or the Internet, and can be integrated with a computer to provide voice and video communication capabilities. The system can be used to facilitate face-to-face meetings and remote collaboration, and can be adapted to different types of work environments.

The present invention relates to a method for processing pictures intended to insert an advertising clip at a point, called insertion point, between two pictures of a sequence of video pictures, called video sequence, comprising the following steps: generating a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point, generating, for each advertising clip of a set of advertising clips, a salience map, determining, for each advertising clip of said set of advertising clips, a degree of similarity between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of said advertising clip, selecting, among said set of advertising clips, the advertising clip having the highest degree of similarity, and inserting the advertising clip selected into the video sequence at the insertion point.

The invention provides a recessed mask structure that reduces high electric field concentrations at intersections with lower dielectric breakdown, in very small dimension semiconductor devices such as found in high speed and high density integrated circuit applications and chip interconnect structures with fine metal features and low dielectric constant insulators.

The text describes the design and implementation of a digital signal processing (DSP) technique for downconverting an IF signal to baseband and digitizing it. The DSP technique involves placing a sampler inside a predictive loop to implement a predictive filter, which is then used to downconvert the IF signal to baseband and digitize it. The predictive loop is designed to minimize the prediction error signal, which is used to adjust the gain of the predictive filter. The dynamic range of the digital predictive loop is improved by reshaping the power spectral density of the quantized error signal, which is then used to adjust the gain of the predictive filter. The implementation of the predictive filter is simplified by using a 1-bit sampler, which allows for dynamic frequency response adjustments. The implementation of the predictive filter is also simplified by using a 9-bit DAC, which provides a maximum peak-to-peak output voltage of 250 mV. The implementation of the predictive filter is also simplified by using a 9-bit rate reduction filter, which allows for reduced noise performance. The implementation of the predictive filter is also simplified by using a 9-bit analog-to-digital converter, which provides a maximum peak-to-peak output voltage of 250 mV. The text describes the method for fabricating arrays of nanotraces on a single wafer for use in multiplex detection arrays. It outlines the fabrication sequence for creating nanotraces, including the use of nanoimprint lithography (NIL) to pattern nanotraces and align them with the active semiconductor layer. The text also discusses the use of anchor probe libraries to detect specific targets, and the detection of target molecules using the nanotraces. The method is described as a cost-effective, time-efficient, and reproducible method for fabricating arrays of nanotraces on a single wafer.

The text describes a singulation and plating method for semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe in order to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces. The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material. The method also includes partial cutting of the leadframe in a single cutting operation before plating the exposed side surfaces, and partial cutting of the leadframe in a single cutting operation after plating the exposed side surfaces. The method also includes partial cutting of the leadframe with a beveled edge, and partial cutting of the leadframe with a full bevel-edged blade. The method also includes partial cutting of the leadframe with a beveled edge and partial cutting of the leadframe with a full bevel-edged blade.
